title: How to Delay Your iPhone Passcode

steps.title: It's a set of gray cogs that you can find on one of your home screens.
steps.content: It's a set of gray cogs that you can find on one of your home screens. If you don't see it, look for a folder labelled Utilities in your App Libraryâ€”it will be in there.

steps.title: It's in the third section of menu options.
steps.content: It's in the third section of menu options. On older devices, this will just say Passcode. If prompted, confirm your current password to continue.

steps.title: If you have fingerprints active on your phone, you'll need to delete them before you proceed.
steps.content: If you have fingerprints active on your phone, you'll need to delete them before you proceed. To do this: Tap on a fingerprint under the Fingerprints section. Tap Delete Fingerprint. Repeat this process with every fingerprint you have saved.

steps.title: The current requirements appear next to this option.
steps.content: The current requirements appear next to this option.

steps.title: Select the amount of time you'd like to allow until your passcode is required.
steps.content: Select the amount of time you'd like to allow until your passcode is required. You can select a number of delay times that range from 1 minute to 4 hours.

steps.title: Now that you've made this change, it will take effect instantly.
steps.content: Now that you've made this change, it will take effect instantly. The amount of time you selected will be able to pass until you are required to re-enter your passcode to unlock it. For example, if you select 1 Minute, you won't be asked for the passcode again if you turn the screen back on before a minute has passed. [1] X Research source
